AC.name: Internal antenna tuner status
AC.notes: P1 controls RX path AT, P2 controls TX path AT, P3 starts/stops tuning. RX IN/THRU cannot be set; tuning will not begin if TX path is THRU; to start, set AC111.

params.description: Start or stop the AT tuning cycle

AI.name: Auto Information (AI) function
AI.notes: When AI is ON, the radio sends answer frames on changes. P1=4 (with backup) is supported from TS‑590S FW 2.00; on P1=2 AI is not retained across power off.

AN.name: Antenna/DRV selection
AN.notes: Enter only parameters you change; use 9 for 'no change'. In TS‑590SG, when DRV is configured as ANT Out, P3 shows antenna output ON/OFF. In answers P1–P3 are never 9.

AS.name: Auto Mode channel entry
AS.notes: Channelized auto-mode map. Frequency is 11 digits in Hz; mode from MD table; Data mode mirrors DA. Channel frequencies must be nondecreasing; resetting all channels: set to 9.5 MHz, LSB, DATA OFF.

params.description: Frequency in Hz (11 digits; pad unused high digits with 0)
CTCSS frequency table index; values map to Hz list

CT.name: CTCSS / Cross Tone function state
CT.notes: If Tone or CTCSS is ON when Cross Tone is turned ON, they automatically turn OFF.

DA.name: DATA mode flag
DA.notes: Usable in LSB/USB/FM/AM; using in CW/FSK causes error. When read in non-DATA mode, P1 is always 0.

DN.name: Frequency/Channel down (MIC DWN)
DN.notes: P1 means one step down; with P1 set (01–99) adjusts by that many steps. In Memory/Quick Memory mode with no P1 acts as channel down.

UP.name: Frequency/Channel up (MIC UP)
UP.notes: P1 means one step up; with P1 set (01–99) adjusts by that many steps. In Memory/Quick Memory mode with no P1 acts as channel up.

EM.name: Emergency communication frequency mode
EM.notes: No parameters. Switches to emergency frequency. Not available on E-market versions.

EQ.name: Equalizer type/mode/curve
EQ.notes: TS‑590S supports from FW 2.00. TX EQ cannot be changed from OFF in CW/CWR/FSK/FSKR modes.

EX.name: Extended menu item access (TS-590SG)
EX.notes: Extended menu item access. Menu number (000-099) + 4 zeros for READ, menu number + 4 zeros + value for SET/ANSWER. Values may be zero-padded (e.g., '05') or unpadded (e.g., '5') - both are valid. Command type determined by source: Local with value = SET, Remote with value = ANSWER. See 'TS-590SG EX Command Parameter List.json' for menu-specific parameters.

params.description: Menu value (omitted for READ). May be zero-padded (e.g., '05') or unpadded (e.g., '5'). Maximum 8 characters. Valid values depend on specific menu item.

parsing_notes: Total parameter length 7 chars (menu + '0000') = READ command
Total parameter length 8+ chars = SET (local source) or ANSWER (remote source)
Numeric values accept both zero-padded ('01', '05') and unpadded ('1', '5') formats
Parameter validation should compare numeric values, not exact string matches

params.description: 11-digit absolute frequency; pad with leading zeros
11-digit absolute frequency; pad with leading zeros

FR.name: Select VFO/Memory (simplex)
FR.notes: FR P1=0/1/2 selects VFO A/B or Memory; FT supports 0/1 only and forces split.

FT.name: Select VFO (split)
FT.notes: FR P1=0/1/2 selects VFO A/B or Memory; FT supports 0/1 only and forces split.

params.description: ASCII firmware version string, e.g., 'FV1.00;'. Returned only.

FW.name: DSP filter bandwidth / FM narrow flag
FW.notes: P1 is bandwidth in Hz for CW and FSK from specific allowed lists. In FM: P1=0000 (Normal) or 0001 (Narrow). Not usable in SSB/AM.

GC.name: AGC mode
GC.notes: P1=3 turns AGC from OFF back to its previous Slow/Fast status; has no effect when AGC already ON. Not available in FM.

GT.name: AGC time constant
GT.notes: Valid 01–20. Not readable if AGC is OFF or in FM.

IF.name: Transceiver status
IF.notes: Comprehensive status frame. Not available in Data mode; AI causes auto answers on certain changes.

params.description: RIT/XIT offset (±9990 Hz). A positive offset has one whitespace and 4 digits. A negative offset has a `-` preceeding the 4 digit offset
(combined with P6 to form channel number, two digits), e.g. 31, together with P6 it becomes 031

ML.name: TX Monitor output level
ML.notes: 000=OFF; TS-590S range 001–009; TS-590SG 001–020. Values above max clamp to max.

MR.name: Memory channel read
MR.notes: P1 distinguishes simplex/split or start/end for section channels. Empty memories return zeros; name blank.

params.description: Filter A/B for stored mode (always 0 on early TS-590S FW 1.xx)

NT.name: Notch Filter
NT.notes: P2 (bandwidth) meaningful only when P1=2 (Manual). In answers, P2 is 0 unless P1=2.

PB.name: Voice/CW message playback
PB.notes: P2 gives playback channel (1–4 or 5=constant). P3–P5 return queue buffer states.

PC.name: Sets and reads the output power
PC.notes: SSB/CW/FM/FSK: 005–100 W; AM: 005–025 W. Step 1 W when Power Fine is ON, otherwise 5 W rounded down.

RI.name: RX frequency and mode (read)
RI.notes: AI auto-answers only on frequency changes during split TX from memory.

params.description: RX mode (see MD), e.g. 1 for LSB

RL.name: Noise Reduction level
RL.notes: When NR1: 01–10 effective level; when NR2: 00–09 (2–20 ms) following speed. Error when NR is OFF.

RM.name: Meter function/value
RM.notes: Answer always returns SWR, COMP, and ALC values.

SD.name: CW break-in delay
SD.notes: 0000=Full break‑in. 0050–1000 ms steps of 50; values round down to nearest step; >1000 clamps to 1000.

SH.name: Receive high‑cut / Shift or Width (SSB-DATA)
SH.notes: 00–99; in SSB‑DATA, SH=Shift. Values above per‑mode max clamp.

SL.name: Receive low‑cut / Width (SSB-DATA)
SL.notes: 00–99; in SSB‑DATA, SL=Width. Values above per‑mode max clamp.

params.description: Used to indicate that the terminal is in use, for example ARCP590G sends TC 1; to the radio to indicate it has connected

TP.name: TX Tune power
TP.notes: 005–100 W. Step and clamping rules same as PC.

TS.name: TF-Set
TS.notes: Set and reads the TF-Set status

TX.name: Transmit control
TX.notes: If no parameter, defaults to 0 (SEND). Answer is only output when AI is ON.

UR.name: RX equalizer (18-band user levels)
UR.notes: Each band level range 00–30, where 06 is 0 dB; each increment = −1 dB step from 06; 30=+6 dB. Requires equalizer not OFF in menu; with AI ON, changes trigger an answer.

UT.name: TX equalizer (18-band user levels)
UT.notes: Each band level range 00–30, where 06 is 0 dB; each increment = −1 dB step from 06; 30=+6 dB. Requires equalizer not OFF in menu; with AI ON, changes trigger an answer.

params.description: Delay in ms (steps of 150; >3000 clamps to 3000)

BD.name: Band select (down slot)
BD.notes: While a Section Memory Channel is displayed, BD sends the start frequency of the displayed range.

BU.name: Band select (up slot)
BU.notes: While a Section Memory Channel is displayed, BU sends the end frequency of the displayed range.

params.description: Adjusts the Notch Frequency of the Manual Notch Filter
Decoded character; 1 char normally, 2 for abbreviations

ES.name: Sets or reads the Advanced startup option

params.description: Shift amount; valid only in CW/CW-R

KY.name: Morse keyer (text / stop)
KY.notes: Answer P1: 0=buffer space available, 1=no buffer space

params.description: Message text (fixed 24 characters, space-padded); A–Z, 0–9, space and symbols ' " ( ) * + , – . / : = ? @ ; plus abbreviations BT, AR, AS, HH, SK, KN, BK, SN
Remaining time or record progress (see manual)

MW.name: Memory write
MW.notes: Field layout mirrors MR; see MR/PR for full semantics.

params.description: Mode, refer to the MD command
Data, refer to the DA command
Tone frequency (refer to the TN command
CTCSS frequency (refer to the CN command)
Selected status of FILTER A/B (Status of FILTER A/B in the mode indicated by P5 and P6 parameters)

PS.name: Power control
PS.notes: When turning power Off by setting the P1 parameter to 0, more current is consumed than if you turn the power Off by operating the transceiver panel power switch. However, you can switch the power back On without any special procedures, using the PS command. When turning the power Off by setting the P1 parameter to 9, the same amount of standby current is consumed as if you turned power Off by operating the transceiver panel power switch. In this case, to turn the power back On using the PS command you must perform the following procedure: 1. When using hardware flow control, turn the flow control off, 2.Send dummy data (;). 3. Send PS1; within 2 seconds of sending the dummy data

QD.name: Deletes the Quick Memory
QD.notes: You cannot perform this command when Quick memory mode is OFF (an error occurs)

QI.name: Stores the settings in the Quick Memory

RA.name: Sets and reads the RF attenuator status

params.notes: only included in the answer, not a part of the set command

RD.name: RIT down one step
RD.notes:
When Scan is OFF: This command is only used for the RIT/XIT frequency. The RU command is used to increase the frequency and the RD command is used to decrease the frequency. When no value for parameter P1 is entered, the frequency is adjusted by 1 step. The RIT/XIT setting has a frequency range of +- 9.999 kHz ~ -9.999 kHz. When Scan is ON: This command is used to set or read the scan speed. When the scan speed changes, a response is returned. When no value for parameter P1 is entered, the current scan speed is retrieved. Enter “RDxxxxx;” to increase the scan speed (where “x” can be
any character). Enter “RUxxxxx;” to increase the scan speed (where “x” can be nany character).  Enter “RDxxxxx;” to decrease the scan speed (where “x” can be any character)

RU.name: RIT down one step
RU.notes:
When Scan is OFF: This command is only used for the RIT/XIT frequency. The RU command is used to increase the frequency and the RD command is used to decrease the frequency. When no value for parameter P1 is entered, the frequency is adjusted by 1 step. The RIT/XIT setting has a frequency range of +- 9.999 kHz ~ -9.999 kHz. When Scan is ON: This command is used to set or read the scan speed. When the scan speed changes, a response is returned. When no value for parameter P1 is entered, the current scan speed is retrieved. Enter “RDxxxxx;” to increase the scan speed (where “x” can be
any character). Enter “RUxxxxx;” to increase the scan speed (where “x” can be nany character).  Enter “RDxxxxx;” to decrease the scan speed (where “x” can be any character)

RX.name: Sets the receiver function status
RX.notes: A response is output only when the AI function is working

enum.1: Scan ON (VFO Scan, Memory Scan, Quick Memory Scan)
Scan ON (VFO Scan, Memory Scan, Quick Memory Scan)

params.description: (0) Cancel the Slow Scan frequency point and outside Slow Scan frequency range, or (1) Set the Slow Scan frequency point and inside Slow Scan frequency range

SP.name: Sets and reads the split operation frequency

enum.1: During the setting operation Setting start.

params.description: Shift direction of the split operation frequency
Shift direction of the split operation frequency
Shift value of split operation frequency 1-9 kHz

SM.name: Reads the S-meter value
SM.notes: The P2 parameter value is the number of dots dsplayed on the meter. The SM command reads the S-meter during reception and the RF (power) during transmission.

SS.name: Sets and reads the Program Slow Scan Frequency

params.description: Memory channel number for Program Slow Scan
Slow down frequency (11 digits in Hz)

enum.0: Program scan section defined memory setting

params.description: Program scan or memory scan setting
The section set in Channel P0. Group 0 when setting the Memory Scan Group
The section set in Channel P1. Group 1 when setting the Memory Scan Group
The section set in Channel P2. Group 2 when setting the Memory Scan Group
The section set in Channel P3. Group 3 when setting the Memory Scan Group
The section set in Channel P4. Group 4 when setting the Memory Scan Group
The section set in Channel P5. Group 5 when setting the Memory Scan Group
The section set in Channel P6. Group 6 when setting the Memory Scan Group
The section set in Channel P7. Group 7 when setting the Memory Scan Group
The section set in Channel P8. Group 8 when setting the Memory Scan Group
The section set in Channel P9. Group 9 when setting the Memory Scan Group
Group P when setting the Memory Scan Group or 0 when setting Program Scan Section
Group E when setting the Memory Scan Group or 0 when setting Program Scan Section

TN.name: Tone frequency index
TN.notes: Sets and reads the Tone frequency

VR.name: Sets and reads the Vox Gain
VR.notes: The cancel status is not retained when the transceiver power is turned off. In TS-590S, the cancel status is retained when the transceiver power is turned off. In TS-590SG, Read and Answer are supported from firmware version 2.00

VG.name: Sets and reads the VOX gain
VG.notes: An entered value of 010 or higher will result in 09 being entered

VS0.name: Sets and reads the Visual Scan start/ stop/ pause status
VS0.notes: Visual Scan will not start when the AI function is OFF. Visual Scan can only be used in VFO mode. You cannot start Visual Scan while transmitting. During Visual Scan, reception is muted and the S meter will not display signal strength. (While paused, reception and the S meter function normally.) During Visual Scan, you cannot change the band, the VFO A/B, the Memory Channel mode, or the Quick Memory Channel mode. Additonally you cannot transmit. When the transceiver power is turned OFF, Visual Scan will also turn OFF

enum.3: Visual Scan restart (when paused) (set command only)

VS1.name: Sets the Visual Scan center frequency
VS1.notes: To read the center frequency, use the VS3; command. The center frequency is stored in each band, and can be changed using the Band Direct key. Do not enter a frequency outside the reception frequency range. An error will occur.

params.description: Center frequency (11 digits in Hz, unused high level digits are set to 0),

VS2.name: Sets the Visual Scan span
VS2.notes: To read the span use the VS3; command. The span is stored in each band, and can be changed using the Band Direct key.

VS3.name: Reads the Visual Scan upper/ lower/ center frequency, and span.

VS4.name: Reads the Visual Scan sweep frequency and signal level

VX.name: VOX on/off
VX.notes:
When transmitting the VX command in CW mode, the Break-in
function is set and read, rather than the VOX function.

XI.name: Reads the transmit frequency and mode.

params.description: Transmission mode (refer to the MD command)

XO.name: Sets and reads the offset direction and frequency for the transverter mode

params.description: (For the transceiver frequency, the transverter frequency can be set in either direction)
Offset frequency in Hz (11 digits in Hz)
